value.string:
# This script is part of ERP5 Web
 #
 # ERP5 Web is an extension to ERP5 which provides a way
 # to create web sites which can display selected
 # ERP5 contents through multiple custom web layouts.
 #
 # This script returns the document which is being displayed
 # in the current in the form of a value (object).
 #
 # If a name parameter is provided, it will lookup
 # the catalog to find a document. If no name parameter
 # is provided, it will analyse the current context
 # (ex. Section, Web Page, etc.) and try to find out
 # which document is being displayed. For example,
 # sections which define a default document may 
 # actually display that document rather than 
 # themselves when asked to render.
 #
 # NOTE: portal param probably useless
 
 # Use the following Variable to determine which
 # 
 
 portal_catalog = portal.portal_catalog
 
 if name is None:
 if context.getPortalType() == 'Web Page':
 return context
 elif context.getPortalType() in ('Web Site', 'Web Section'):
 return context.WebSite_getDefaultWebPageValue()
 else:
 return None
 
 #If name is not None, it has to be searched for it in the catalog.
 
 # This Function helps do sort different Versions of the same Document.
 def compareVersion(c1, c2):
 c1_value = c1.getObject() 
 c2_value = c2.getObject()
 return cmp(c2_value.getVersion(), c1_value.getVersion()) 
 
 #from Products.ERP5Type.Cache import CachingMethod
 def getDocument(name):
 # First try to get a published document
 matching_document_list = portal_catalog(reference = '%s' % name, validation_state='published')
 if len(matching_document_list):
 matching_document_list=list(matching_document_list)
 matching_document_list.sort(compareVersion)
 return matching_document_list[0].getObject()
 # Then try to get a validated document (Product)
 matching_document_list = portal_catalog(reference = '%s' % name, validation_state='validated')
 if len(matching_document_list):
 matching_document_list=list(matching_document_list)
 matching_document_list.sort(compareVersion)
 return matching_document_list[0].getObject()
 # Then try to get any document
 matching_document_list = portal_catalog(reference = '%s' % name)
 if len(matching_document_list):
 matching_document_list=list(matching_document_list)
 matching_document_list.sort(compareVersion)
 return matching_document_list[0].getObject()
 return None 
 
 return getDocument(name)
